name: Hotel Plaza De Armas

reviews.text: I stayed here for five nights while doing some work for a nonprofit. The primary pluses are location and cost. It is in the center of Old San Juan, on a nice little plaza. A full grocery store is one block away. The hotel serves a breakfast in the morning that includes fruit, cereal, etc., served on paper plates. Nothing great, but not terrible either. The hotel is apparently in an old apartment building converted to this purpose.
reviews.title: Acceptable and Reasonably Priced

likes.disliked: — Lack of windows in rooms and a single, ancient elevator

reviews.title: Think again before staying here!
reviews.text: Rooms: You will want a room with a queen size bed or larger. Our group found smaller beds in other rooms that were unacceptable, even for one person. There are no windows in most rooms (except those facing the street). The rooms are very quiet, especially since there is an air conditioner in each room. Rooms are reasonably spacious and wi-fi is included at no cost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elevator: There is a single elevator that moves at a speed of about one minute per floor (literally). This is a four story building. If you have no problem walking up and down stairs, you will use the cramped staircase instead of the elevator. If you need to use an elevator, you are going to have frustrations. Depending on your physical condition, a lower floor might be desirable.
reviews.title: We Looooved this Hotel

likes.liked: — The staff was friendly...and the room was very clean and also the nice size bathroom. Excellent air conditioning... especially with the very hot climate.
likes.disliked: — This was the least the I liked, but it really didnt bother much....The slow elevator...it was slow but it worked!

reviews.text: Staff: We found the staff to be quite pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location, decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this seems to be a hotel used primarily by cruise ship passengers for a single night stay on one end or the other. So long as you are not looking for luxury and have no problem with stairs, the hotel is quite acceptable. If you intend to spend any meaningful amount of time in the room or hotel, you will find it a bit dreary, but a bargain. We did not encounter issues of cleanliness mentioned elsewhere, but this is not a corporate hotel, so one could expect variations.
reviews.title: Surprisingly unique

reviews.text: We booked this hotel two nights prior taking a cruise and one night after our cruise. There were six of us traveling, so we booked three rooms. All of us agreed that this hotel met our expectations. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Every thing there was within walking distance. There are two pharmacies across the street. There are a lot of souvenir stores, the house were the pina colada was born (Barrachina) was around the block. There are a lot of restaurants close by. We went to Jibaritos, a puerto rican restaurant, located about six blocks from there. Continental breakfast was included so that was very convenient for us. The elevator from the hotel is more than 100 years old!!! It was very tiny and slow; so we used the tiny stairs all the time...if you don't like to use the stairs or have a lot of lugagge ask for a room on the first floor. The people at the lobby were very friendly and polite. There are no phones on the rooms but since we all had our cell phones we didn't care. The rooms had no windows but that did not bother any of us. The rooms were clean, and we felt safe all the time. If you would like to be close to the beach then this is not the hotel you need. If you want a good location to explore the old San Juan within walking distance at a reasonable price; then I would recomend you this hotel.
reviews.title: Location, location, location: Best Location in old San Juan

reviews.text: The hotel is in an ideal location in Old San Juan. The Plaza is a great spot for people watching, meeting locals, and getting some coffee. The big problem with Old San Juan for me was that there aren't very many street signs on the buildings at intersections, so often times you really don't have a clue what street you're on. After driving in and out of Old San Juan though, you start to figure it out (it's not that big an area). This is an old colonial building converted in to a hotel. That means most of the rooms don't have windows because the houses had windows in the front and back to allow air to pass through the house and cool it down. Side rooms didn't have windows. I guess the door were just left open. If you want a room with a view, don't stay here. If you want a large room, this isn't the place to stay. If you want someplace to rest your head at night, this will do just fine. The air conditioner in my room sounded like, well, an air conditioner. If you're used to very high end central air conditioning that makes nary a sound, I suppose you might find it noisy. If you're used to the sound a window air conditioner makes (white noise), you'll be perplexed by the negative comments left by others about the sound the AC makes. The continental breakfast offered is decent, and should be taken advantage of (pastries, cereal, fruit, toast, juice, coffee). The staff is friendly and helpful, and made sure we knew which parking garage had the best rates (thank goodness! There was a big difference!). The elevator did break down one day while I was there, and it's slow, but it's not like it takes 10 minutes to get between floors. This is hardly unusual at a hotel in a building that was built before elevators were even invented (stay at any old converted hotel in Paris, and this elevator will seem like heaven by comparison). The staff gladly helped my travel companion with her bag the day the elevator was broken. I would describe the hotel decor in the lobby and lounge area as "Pottery Barn." And I rather liked the tile work in the lobby. If I were to stay in Old San Juan again, I would definitely stay here. Compared to the prices of other hotels, this was definitely the best deal I found. If your focus during a vacation is getting out and enjoying the sites and culture, and want your hotel to be safe and comfortable but not the focus of your stay, this is a good option for you.
reviews.title: Good place to stay in Old San Juan

reviews.text: The room decor was nice. The room was small and windowless but that was expected. The AC system was the worst I have experienced. The unit was extremely loud and totally enclosed in the the room. Instead of exhausting the hot air outside it was blown into the drop ceiling of the bathroom. Made the bathroom feel like a sauna. Even ear plugs did not adequately damped the noise of the almost constantly running AC unit.
reviews.title: Spend a little extra and stay some where else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Howard Johnson for one night on the way out of Puerto Rico because we had a very early flight and didn't really care about the room. It was approx. $132 (inc. taxes, etc.) and would have cost around $80 in the US mainland but everything is overpriced in Puerto Rico. The room had no windows and was very small. It was, however, extremely clean. The check-in took a while because the one and only person there was on the phone with someone else. It is centrally located but parking is a problem. They suggest a parking lot 3 blocks away. We drove around a bit and, fortunately, found something in front but only because we were planning to leave at 6 a.m. so the reserved parking spots were not being enforced. Only the rooms facing the front street have windows. If you're looking for something centrally located, don't want to pay too much AND you don't care about the ambience, then this is fine. Otherwise, it's an overpiced average hotel.
reviews.title: So So

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought this would be an ideal place to spend the night prior to a cruise. We arrived on time and checked in. The elevator didn't work and everyone had to use the stairs. We were told that the elevator
reviews.title: Dreary, Moldy and Out of Order

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there last Friday night and thought despite some issues it was a good deal for 120 including tax. This hotel is in a great location of Old SJ, however it is difficult to find if you are not familiar with OLD SJ like us. Our room was very small, but we expected that in this area however it was also rather rough around the edges. For example, there were small holes and stains on the sheets and the back of the bathroom door was downright dirty. There was also a little dirt in the shower the washed down the drain when I turned on the water and about a dozen hairs throughout the bathroom. The employees were very helpful and the breakfast buffet of fruit, danishes, cereal, coffee and juice was fine for this good of a price. The elevator is very slow and seems quite dangerous. We waited 10 minutes (I seriously timed it) for it when we were leaving and the front desk employee finally took it up to my husband when I came down the stairs and noticed it was just sitting empty at the lobby. We slept very well there because the walls are thick and a fan is constantly circulating air since there are not any windows. I would stay there if I returned to the area and would recommend it to a friend who does not mind these issues if the price is right! I don't think you could find a better hotel, at this price in such a great location!
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

likes.disliked: — Hard to find, dirt/hairs in bathroom

reviews.text: I stayed at HoJo's on my way back from Vieques. Overrall it was in a great location and the hotel was nice but I don't think it was worth the money being asked. The rooms are very small and it feels a little stuffy. The elevator was small and slow and doesn't always work. The staff was helpful with the few problems we encountered. Our air conditioner stopped working in the middle of the night and we had to change rooms. This was done quickly and the night person was very nice. They did a great job remodeling the place. It was no trip to paradise but it served the purpose and it was quiet. I probably would stay there again but would look to see how big the larger rooms are first.
reviews.title: OK

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds and quiet at night
likes.disliked: — small rooms and very slow elevator

reviews.text: The location really is great -- right on a main sqare, with a trolley stop outside. I had an inside room (so no windows) and that was a little weird, but I was out most of the day and night and came back just to sleep so it didn't affect me. The people were really nice to me throughout my stay -- especially after I missed my flight and had to find a room at 8PM on a Friday night! (Note: Get to the airport 2 hours early no matter what the airline says. The people move really slowly in San Juan! I should have had more than enough time except for the line literally didn't move for 30 minutes, and then just barely). There's nothing glamorous about this place, but it is clean and it's a great price. The free breakfast was more like a hostel breakfast, so unless you're really on a budget, I'd venture out and eat something a little more local in flavor. As for parking, there are several paid lots that seem far away but are actually right on the free trolley line. However, I didn't have to use them -- I had great luck both nights finding street parking between 5-7PM -- after the working people left for the day and before the diners and party-ers came in for the clubs and stuff. When all is said and done, however, I wish I had foregone the rental car -- it was a liability more than an asset. If you do get one, get the smallest one possible -- the streets are very narrow.
reviews.title: Really is a great location

likes.disliked: — the elevator was out of service for part of the time

reviews.title: Great location. Good price for a single.
reviews.text: Old San Juan was built when the buildings were all connected except when they bordered a street, so don't expect windows in a building in the middle of the block. My room had no windows, but I read the reviews and knew that. The elevator was slow, but it worked. Good value for a single. It's a Howard Johnson, so don't expect high end. I found all the complaints unfounded for this type of hotel. I would definitely return for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Howard Johnson Inn at Plaza de Armas to be exactly as expected, based on these reviews. It was very clean and my singe-bed room was surprisingly large - although it had no window. I had no problems with noise. My room was impressively clean and well taken care of. The staff at the front desk was efficient and business-like. . . not particularly friendly. The free breakfast was simply a nicer continental breakfast -- nothing hot. The location was EXCELLENT. I paid only $100 for my room and was satisfied because I was there for only 5-6 hours of sleep. I would be reluctant to pay $160+ to stay because this hotel is simply a clean place to sleep and to be in the middle of the action. I believe there are other, nicer, more authentic and unique, places to stay in Old San Juan once you reach the $180+ range.
reviews.title: Good place to crash . . .

likes.disliked: — Lack of character - lack of windows in every room

reviews.title: HORRIBLE noise throughout the night...worst ever experienced!
reviews.text: There are a couple of reserved parking spots right in front of the hotel for loading and unloading. Otherwise, parking is very difficult on the streets around the hotel. However, once you drop off your luggage, there are several parking garages within close proximity (approx. 5 blocks). DONT try to carry your luggage from the car garages -- the sidewalks and streets are cobble-stone, are VERY narrow and are filled with lots of people.
Don't even think about staying here if you value your sleep.
reviews.title: Good value, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noise levels throughout the night were TORTURE. Hall light streamed into the room through a window above the door- so I was left to try and sleep with bright lights and noise every night.
reviews.title: Good Value, Great location

reviews.text: Phone in the room didn't work and water was never hot, just lukewarm, and rooms don't have windows...but these were the least of my concerns.
reviews.title: Don't be scared off by the reviews-a good deal

description: Welcome to Hotel Plaza De Armas, located in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. Hotel Plaza De Armas is for travelers looking to be in the heart of Old San Juan, our hotel is in a coveted location in the historic quarter. Hotel Plaza de Armas is a delightfully captivating colonial style hotel in the heart of picturesque Old San Juan, a city as rich in history as it is in culture. The blue cobblestone streets of the old city sprawl out in every direction and world-class shopping, dining and entertainment abounds. The hotel's Spanish colonial-inspired lounge is decorated in rich red and gold with warm lighting and leather couches.A completely unique location highlights spectacular views of the Plaza De Armas and puts you mere cobblestones away from 16th century Spanish fortresses, fascinating museums and art galleries. We are just a block away from the Cathedral of San Juan Bautista. The Cathedral of San Juan Bautista is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico.The cathedral is one of the oldest buildings in San Juan, and is the second oldest cathedral in the Western Hemisphere. Construction of Cathedral San Juan began began in 1521.[1]The cathedral contains the tomb of the Spanish explorer and settlement founder Juan Ponce de León.The 50 rooms at the Hotel Plaza De Armas are wrapped around a spacious inner courtyard. They're clean and modest with simple touches such as wood wardrobes, headboards and nightstands, and stainless steel lamps. All rooms have clock radios, coffeemakers, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, in-room safe and a television with cable. Suites have floor-to-ceiling shutters that open for views of the cobblestone streets. Some suites have small refrigerators and sofa beds. The modest standard rooms have no windows. Suites have windows overlooking the historic district. Hotel Plaza De Armas also offers high-speed Internet access.From its uniquely Spanish-colonial architecture to its comforting in-room amenities, the Hotel Plaza De Armas PR offers guests the perfect blend of Old World charm and New World elegance. We are just a walking distance from the City Hall (Alcaldia) of Old San Juan and right next to an 18th century building where you can find the Department of State. Also we have a trolley stop right outside our door .We look forward to welcoming you at Hotel Plaza De Armas!
